Content.Name: Social Media
Content.Title: Social Media
Content.Abstract: Tips on how to effectively use social media websites
Content.BodyCopy:
Did you know that more than sixty percent of Americans use social media? And that number is growing - which means that there's a big chance that your students and potential students are on sites such as Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter. Social media outlets are a great way to connect to new people and stay in constant contact.

Facebook:

There are many features in which you can promote awareness and interaction on Facebook. Also, many students have already created Facebook pages to help everyone interact and stay updated about what's going on in classes and institutes. Make sure you're aware of this and know about these pages so that you can interact with those students as well.

  • When updating statuses, use question polls to survey users about what they think about specific topics.
  • Along with question polls, status updates should inform viewers of news and information that they may not be aware of. It's also a nice touch to post inspiring quotes that may help others be inspired to be more diligent or strive to do their best obtaining an education.
  • A lot of people are transitioning into using event invitations on Facebook to let others know of events going on and getting a count of how many people are attending. This is also a great tool that you can use, too. You can easily invite everyone in a quick amount of time.

Twitter:

Did you know you can link your Twitter account to your Facebook so that everything that you post on Facebook goes onto your Twitter account and vice versa? Twitter is a great way to constantly post news or updates you want others to know. Messages posted on Twitter are confined to only 140 characters and there are a lot of different topics bouncing off from one another so conversations on Twitter are quick.

LinkedIn:

LinkedIn is a more business-oriented networking site. There is already a page that most people from BYU-Idaho are connected to called The Official BYU-Idaho Student and Alumni Network. Students can connect with this page and post questions about jobs, articles they've read, and many other things for other students who have attended or are attending BYU-Idaho to respond to in a more professional manner.

Email:

It's important to check your email daily and respond to emails as soon as possible. Emails are an efficient way of communication. Let students and others know your email and that they should feel free contacting you through your email.
